types.name: Float
types.description: The `Float` scalar type represents signed double-precision fractional values as specified by [IEEE 754](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_floating_point).

types.name: ID
types.description: The `ID` scalar type represents a unique identifier, often used to refetch an object or as key for a cache. The ID type appears in a JSON response as a String; however, it is not intended to be human-readable. When expected as an input type, any string (such as `"4"`) or integer (such as `4`) input value will be accepted as an ID.

args.name: srcSetBreakpoints
args.description: A list of image widths to be generated. Example: [ 200, 340, 520, 890 ]

args.name: aspectRatio
args.description:
If set along with width or height, this will set the value of the other dimension to match the provided aspect ratio, cropping the image if needed.
If neither width or height is provided, height will be set based on the intrinsic width of the source image.

args.name: avifOptions
args.description: Options to pass to sharp when generating AVIF images.

args.name: backgroundColor
args.description: Background color applied to the wrapper. Also passed to sharp to use as a background when "letterboxing" an image to another aspect ratio.

args.name: blurredOptions
args.description: Options for the low-resolution placeholder image. Set placeholder to "BLURRED" to use this

args.name: breakpoints
args.description:
Specifies the image widths to generate. For FIXED and CONSTRAINED images it is better to allow these to be determined automatically,
based on the image size. For FULL_WIDTH images this can be used to override the default, which is [750, 1080, 1366, 1920].
It will never generate any images larger than the source.

args.name: formats
args.description:
The image formats to generate. Valid values are "AUTO" (meaning the same format as the source image), "JPG", "PNG", "WEBP" and "AVIF".
The default value is [AUTO, WEBP], and you should rarely need to change this. Take care if you specify JPG or PNG when you do
not know the formats of the source images, as this could lead to unwanted results such as converting JPEGs to PNGs. Specifying
both PNG and JPG is not supported and will be ignored.

args.name: height
args.description:
The display height of the generated image for layout = FIXED, and the maximum display height of the largest image for layout = CONSTRAINED.
The image will be cropped if the aspect ratio does not match the source image. If omitted, it is calculated from the supplied width,
matching the aspect ratio of the source image.

args.name: jpgOptions
args.description: Options to pass to sharp when generating JPG images.

args.name: layout
args.description:
The layout for the image.
FIXED: A static image sized, that does not resize according to the screen width
FULL_WIDTH: The image resizes to fit its container. Pass a "sizes" option if it isn't going to be the full width of the screen.
CONSTRAINED: Resizes to fit its container, up to a maximum width, at which point it will remain fixed in size.

args.name: outputPixelDensities
args.description:
A list of image pixel densities to generate. It will never generate images larger than the source, and will always include a 1x image.
Default is [ 1, 2 ] for FIXED images, meaning 1x and 2x and [0.25, 0.5, 1, 2] for CONSTRAINED. In this case, an image with a constrained layout
and width = 400 would generate images at 100, 200, 400 and 800px wide. Ignored for FULL_WIDTH images, which use breakpoints instead

args.name: placeholder
args.description:
Format of generated placeholder image, displayed while the main image loads.
BLURRED: a blurred, low resolution image, encoded as a base64 data URI
DOMINANT_COLOR: a solid color, calculated from the dominant color of the image (default).
TRACED_SVG: deprecated. Will use DOMINANT_COLOR.
NONE: no placeholder. Set "background" to use a fixed background color.

args.name: pngOptions
args.description: Options to pass to sharp when generating PNG images.

args.name: quality
args.description: The default quality. This is overridden by any format-specific options

args.name: sizes
args.description:
The "sizes" property, passed to the img tag. This describes the display size of the image.
This does not affect the generated images, but is used by the browser to decide which images to download.
You should usually leave this blank, and a suitable value will be calculated. The exception is if a FULL_WIDTH image
does not actually span the full width of the screen, in which case you should pass the correct size here.

args.name: tracedSVGOptions
args.description: Options for traced placeholder SVGs. You also should set placeholder to "TRACED_SVG".

args.name: transformOptions
args.description: Options to pass to sharp to control cropping and other image manipulations.

args.name: webpOptions
args.description: Options to pass to sharp when generating WebP images.

args.name: width
args.description:
The display width of the generated image for layout = FIXED, and the maximum display width of the largest image for layout = CONSTRAINED.
Ignored if layout = FLUID.

types.name: Int
types.description: The `Int` scalar type represents non-fractional signed whole numeric values. Int can represent values between -(2^31) and 2^31 - 1.

types.name: JSON
types.description: The `JSON` scalar type represents JSON values as specified by [ECMA-404](http://www.ecma-international.org/publications/files/ECMA-ST/ECMA-404.pdf).

fields.name: gatsbyImage
fields.description: Data used in the <GatsbyImage /> component. See https://gatsby.dev/img for more info.

args.name: aspectRatio
args.description:
If set along with width or height, this will set the value of the other dimension to match the provided aspect ratio, cropping the image if needed.
If neither width or height is provided, height will be set based on the intrinsic width of the source image.

args.name: backgroundColor
args.description: Background color applied to the wrapper, or when "letterboxing" an image to another aspect ratio.

args.name: breakpoints
args.description:
Specifies the image widths to generate. You should rarely need to change this. For FIXED and CONSTRAINED images it is better to allow these to be determined automatically,
based on the image size. For FULL_WIDTH images this can be used to override the default, which is [750, 1080, 1366, 1920].
It will never generate any images larger than the source.

args.name: formats
args.description:
The image formats to generate. Valid values are AUTO (meaning the same format as the source image), JPG, PNG, WEBP and AVIF.
The default value is [AUTO, WEBP, AVIF], and you should rarely need to change this. Take care if you specify JPG or PNG when you do
not know the formats of the source images, as this could lead to unwanted results such as converting JPEGs to PNGs. Specifying
both PNG and JPG is not supported and will be ignored.

args.name: height
args.description: If set, the height of the generated image. If omitted, it is calculated from the supplied width, matching the aspect ratio of the source image.

args.name: layout
args.description:
The layout for the image.
FIXED: A static image sized, that does not resize according to the screen width
FULL_WIDTH: The image resizes to fit its container. Pass a "sizes" option if it isn't going to be the full width of the screen.
CONSTRAINED: Resizes to fit its container, up to a maximum width, at which point it will remain fixed in size.

args.name: outputPixelDensities
args.description:
A list of image pixel densities to generate for FIXED and CONSTRAINED images. You should rarely need to change this. It will never generate images larger than the source, and will always include a 1x image.
Default is [ 1, 2 ] for fixed images, meaning 1x, 2x, and [0.25, 0.5, 1, 2] for fluid. In this case, an image with a fluid layout and width = 400 would generate images at 100, 200, 400 and 800px wide.

args.name: placeholder
args.description:
Format of generated placeholder image, displayed while the main image loads.
BLURRED: a blurred, low resolution image, encoded as a base64 data URI
DOMINANT_COLOR: a solid color, calculated from the dominant color of the image (default).
TRACED_SVG: deprecated. Will use DOMINANT_COLOR.
NONE: no placeholder. Set the argument "backgroundColor" to use a fixed background color.

args.name: sizes
args.description:
The "sizes" property, passed to the img tag. This describes the display size of the image.
This does not affect the generated images, but is used by the browser to decide which images to download. You can leave this blank for fixed images, or if the responsive image
container will be the full width of the screen. In these cases we will generate an appropriate value.

args.name: width
args.description:
The display width of the generated image for layout = FIXED, and the display width of the largest image for layout = CONSTRAINED.
The actual largest image resolution will be this value multiplied by the largest value in outputPixelDensities
Ignored if layout = FLUID.

args.name: format
args.description:
The image formats to generate. Valid values are AUTO (meaning the same format as the source image), JPG, PNG, WEBP and AVIF.
The default value is [AUTO, WEBP, AVIF], and you should rarely need to change this. Take care if you specify JPG or PNG when you do
not know the formats of the source images, as this could lead to unwanted results such as converting JPEGs to PNGs. Specifying
both PNG and JPG is not supported and will be ignored.

types.name: WpAvatar
types.description: Avatars are profile images for users. WordPress by default uses the Gravatar service to host and fetch avatars from.

fields.name: default
fields.description: URL for the default image or a default type. Accepts '404' (return a 404 instead of a default image), 'retro' (8bit), 'monsterid' (monster), 'wavatar' (cartoon face), 'indenticon' (the 'quilt'), 'mystery', 'mm', or 'mysteryman' (The Oyster Man), 'blank' (transparent GIF), or 'gravatar_default' (the Gravatar logo).

fields.name: extraAttr
fields.description: HTML attributes to insert in the IMG element. Is not sanitized.

fields.name: forceDefault
fields.description: Whether to always show the default image, never the Gravatar.

fields.name: foundAvatar
fields.description: Whether the avatar was successfully found.

fields.name: height
fields.description: Height of the avatar image.

fields.name: rating
fields.description: What rating to display avatars up to. Accepts 'G', 'PG', 'R', 'X', and are judged in that order.

fields.name: scheme
fields.description: Type of url scheme to use. Typically HTTP vs. HTTPS.

fields.name: size
fields.description: The size of the avatar in pixels. A value of 96 will match a 96px x 96px gravatar image.

fields.name: url
fields.description: URL for the gravatar image source.

fields.name: width
fields.description: Width of the avatar image.

fields.description: Data used in the <GatsbyImage /> component. See https://gatsby.dev/img for more info.

args.name: aspectRatio
args.description:
If set along with width or height, this will set the value of the other dimension to match the provided aspect ratio, cropping the image if needed.
If neither width or height is provided, height will be set based on the intrinsic width of the source image.

args.name: backgroundColor
args.description: Background color applied to the wrapper, or when "letterboxing" an image to another aspect ratio.

args.name: breakpoints
args.description:
Specifies the image widths to generate. You should rarely need to change this. For FIXED and CONSTRAINED images it is better to allow these to be determined automatically,
based on the image size. For FULL_WIDTH images this can be used to override the default, which is [750, 1080, 1366, 1920].
It will never generate any images larger than the source.

args.name: formats
args.description:
The image formats to generate. Valid values are AUTO (meaning the same format as the source image), JPG, PNG, WEBP and AVIF.
The default value is [AUTO, WEBP, AVIF], and you should rarely need to change this. Take care if you specify JPG or PNG when you do
not know the formats of the source images, as this could lead to unwanted results such as converting JPEGs to PNGs. Specifying
both PNG and JPG is not supported and will be ignored.

args.name: height
args.description: If set, the height of the generated image. If omitted, it is calculated from the supplied width, matching the aspect ratio of the source image.

args.name: layout
args.description:
The layout for the image.
FIXED: A static image sized, that does not resize according to the screen width
FULL_WIDTH: The image resizes to fit its container. Pass a "sizes" option if it isn't going to be the full width of the screen.
CONSTRAINED: Resizes to fit its container, up to a maximum width, at which point it will remain fixed in size.

args.name: outputPixelDensities
args.description:
A list of image pixel densities to generate for FIXED and CONSTRAINED images. You should rarely need to change this. It will never generate images larger than the source, and will always include a 1x image.
Default is [ 1, 2 ] for fixed images, meaning 1x, 2x, and [0.25, 0.5, 1, 2] for fluid. In this case, an image with a fluid layout and width = 400 would generate images at 100, 200, 400 and 800px wide.

args.name: placeholder
args.description:
Format of generated placeholder image, displayed while the main image loads.
BLURRED: a blurred, low resolution image, encoded as a base64 data URI
DOMINANT_COLOR: a solid color, calculated from the dominant color of the image (default).
TRACED_SVG: deprecated. Will use DOMINANT_COLOR.
NONE: no placeholder. Set the argument "backgroundColor" to use a fixed background color.

args.name: sizes
args.description:
The "sizes" property, passed to the img tag. This describes the display size of the image.
This does not affect the generated images, but is used by the browser to decide which images to download. You can leave this blank for fixed images, or if the responsive image
container will be the full width of the screen. In these cases we will generate an appropriate value.

args.name: width
args.description:
The display width of the generated image for layout = FIXED, and the display width of the largest image for layout = CONSTRAINED.
The actual largest image resolution will be this value multiplied by the largest value in outputPixelDensities
Ignored if layout = FLUID.

fields.name: commentStatus
fields.description: Whether the comments are open or closed for this particular post.

fields.name: comments
fields.description: Connection between the Post type and the Comment type

fields.name: content
fields.description: The content of the post.

fields.name: contentType
fields.description: Connection between the ContentNode type and the ContentType type

fields.name: contentTypeName
fields.description: The name of the Content Type the node belongs to

fields.name: databaseId
fields.description: The unique identifier stored in the database

fields.name: date
fields.description: Post publishing date.

args.name: difference
args.description: Returns the difference between this date and the current time. Defaults to "milliseconds" but you can also pass in as the measurement "years", "months", "weeks", "days", "hours", "minutes", and "seconds".

args.name: formatString
args.description: Format the date using Moment.js' date tokens, e.g. `date(formatString: "YYYY MMMM DD")`. See https://momentjs.com/docs/#/displaying/format/ for documentation for different tokens.

args.name: fromNow
args.description: Returns a string generated with Moment.js' `fromNow` function

args.name: locale
args.description: Configures the locale Moment.js will use to format the date.

fields.name: dateGmt
fields.description: The publishing date set in GMT.

fields.name: shouldShowAdminToolbar

fields.name: url

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name, description and optional `specifiedByURL`, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields`, `interfaces`, and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

types.name: __Field
types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

enumValues.name: FIELD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

enumValues.name: VARIABLE_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a variable definition.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object type definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object type definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.

directives.name: childOf
directives.description: Define parent-child relations between types. This is used to add `child*` and `children*` convenience fields like `childImageSharp`.

args.name: mimeTypes
args.description: A list of mime-types this type is a child of. Usually these are the mime-types handled by a transformer plugin.

args.name: types
args.description: A list of types this type is a child of. Usually these are the types handled by a transformer plugin.

directives.name: deprecated
directives.description: Marks an element of a GraphQL schema as no longer supported.

args.name: reason
args.description: Explains why this element was deprecated, usually also including a suggestion for how to access supported similar data. Formatted using the Markdown syntax, as specified by [CommonMark](https://commonmark.org/).

directives.name: dontInfer
directives.description: Do not infer field types from field values.

directives.name: fileByRelativePath
directives.description: Link to File node by relative path.

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true.

args.name: if
args.description: Included when true.

directives.name: infer
directives.description: Infer field types from field values.

directives.name: link
directives.description: Link to node by foreign-key relation.

directives.name: mimeTypes
directives.description: Define the mime-types handled by this type.

args.name: types
args.description: The mime-types handled by this type.

directives.name: nodeInterface
directives.description:
DEPRECATED: Use interface inheritance instead, i.e. "interface Foo implements Node".

Adds root query fields for an interface. All implementing types must also implement the Node interface.

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if` argument is true.

args.name: if
args.description: Skipped when true.
